posts.post_content:
Ahh poor timmyforever... have to make the rounds and prove to everyone that you're ignorant yet again, eh?  
  
This is going to be the biggest bird of all time if you combo him right... Use lots of populate effects, put little creatures into play... Think about this, playing naya midrange or something...  
  
T4: Play this card...  
T5: [Assemble the Legion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Assemble the Legion)  
T6: [Maze Behemoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maze Behemoth)  
  
all those +3/+3's and he gets trample... That's just one combo too.  
  
This card is balanced because if it was any better it wouldn't be an uncommon anymore...

Posted By: Vakyoom (4/24/2013 8:15:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This plus [Eyes in the Sky](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eyes in the Sky) is going to be a good way to inflict a lot of pain in limited, especially since they're both solid cards you should be playing anyway (though really any flash creature/ instant speed token maker or populate is still a free giant growth with this). [Griffin Protector](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griffin Protector) was good and while this doesn't have evasion and doesn't have as good stats, the bonus being much bigger more than makes up for it, essentially forcing a chump if you can manage more than one creature per turn and *only* a 5/5 if you keep playing creatures. Also, I love that White gets Birds and Green doesn't get fliers so W/G gets flightless birds, in what I hope is an official color pie slice now.
posts.html:
This plus Eyes in the Sky is going to be a good way to inflict a lot of pain in limited, especially since they're both solid cards you should be playing anyway (though really any flash creature/ instant speed token maker or populate is still a free giant growth with this). Griffin Protector was good and while this doesn't have evasion and doesn't have as good stats, the bonus being much bigger more than makes up for it, essentially forcing a chump if you can manage more than one creature per turn and only a 5/5 if you keep playing creatures. Also, I love that White gets Birds and Green doesn't get fliers so W/G gets flightless birds, in what I hope is an official color pie slice now.

posts.post_content:
I must say, the fact that it gets +3/+3 rather than +2/+2 is what made this card even more appealing (yeah, not even the fact that it should have had trample). Why? It's because it's more and more tempting to want to abuse the ability!  
Who wouldn't want to put, like a gazillion tokens into play and add some evasion on this creature by seeing that ability? Please be honest :D  
5/5

posts.post_content:
This bird is just BEGGING to get a [Fists of Ironwood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fists of Ironwood) tacked onto it.  
Drop on that, it's suddenly an 8/8 trample for only 2 mana and the trample persists.  
  
This might find a niche in classic Selesnya decks, moreso than RtR Selesnya decks.  
  
And don't start me on a beefy [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) (shudder)..
